alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:49PM CDT until further notice by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Texas... Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria County. For the Guadalupe River...including Victoria, Bloomington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River at Victoria. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon, until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, water crosses Fordyce Road at the large culvert between the lakes. The main portion of Saxet Lake Park is closed and water covers some of the picnic areas and roads. Gates located at the intersection of Fordyce Road and Fox road, as well as the intersection of Fordyce Road and Timber Drive are closed and no traffic is allowed through. Water is under the U. S. Business 59 East and West relief bridges, and over Criag and Constitution. Areas west of Moody Street between Water and Constituion are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue to rise to 29.1 feet by Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Guadalupe River Victoria 21.0 13.7 Fri 10 pm 27.5 28.0 28.3 28.9 29.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.
